translated: Here, by the rite taught previously, first, in the center of a moon at the heart, one should visualize the seed syllable of Mañjuśrī, the fifth of the sixth, filled with the sound of the fifth vowel, pressed down by two emptinesses.

analyzed: mchod cing mngon par phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: one should make offerings and pay homage.

translated: Having first made a prayer, one should meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: ham zhes so //
analyzed: ham zhes so //
translated: Oṃ śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

analyzed: de nas sa bon la khams gsum ma lus pa @103b sgyu ma'i dpe'i rnam par bsams te /
translated: Then, having visualized the seed syllable, one should think of the entire three realms in the aspect of an illusion.

original: bltas shing reg nas thams cad sgyu ma ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bltas shing reg nas thams cad sgyu ma ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Having looked and touched, everything is just like an illusion.

original: dmigs pa med pas 'gro ba gnas pa thams cad dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas 'gro ba gnas pa thams cad dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Since there is no object, one should liberate all beings.

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
translated: Oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon las 'khrungs pa'i dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje zur phud lngas dbu la brgyan pa gzhon nu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i sa bon las 'khrungs pa'i dpal ldan 'jam pa'i rdo rje zur phud lngas dbu la brgyan pa gzhon nu rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: One should visualize oneself as glorious Mañjuvajra born from the previously mentioned seed syllable, with a crown of five locks of hair, adorned with all the ornaments of a youth,

original: gur gum gyi mdog ltar dmar ba /
analyzed: gur gum gyi mdog ltar dmar ba /
translated: the color of saffron,

original: phyag g-yon na autpal bsnams pa g-yas pa rol pa'i stabs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon na autpal bsnams pa g-yas pa rol pa'i stabs kyis gnas pa /
translated: holding a blue lotus in the left hand, and standing in the pose of royal poise with the right hand.

original: seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i bdag nyid gzhon nu'i sku bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i bdag nyid gzhon nu'i sku bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine oneself as the youthful Mañjuśrī sitting on a lion throne.

original: phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the mudrā:

original: phyag gnyis thal mo sbyar nas mdzub mo dag dang ming med dag gi sen mos autpa la kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis thal mo sbyar nas mdzub mo dag dang ming med dag gi sen mos autpa la kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: With the two hands joined in añjali, the index fingers and ring fingers are in the shape of an open utpala flower.

original: snying ga mdzod spu mgrin pa'i steng rnams su bsrung bar byas nas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga mdzod spu mgrin pa'i steng rnams su bsrung bar byas nas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having protected the heart, the point between the eyebrows, and the throat, one should recite.

original: aom w'a g'i shva ri mum /
analyzed: aom w'a g'i shva ri mum /
translated: Oṃ vāgīśvari muḥ.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Noble Mañjughoṣa is complete.
